intro: Dyschoriste cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-colored dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
